contextId.information: This is an exaggeration. The only valuable thing she had was a jar of oil. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: nothing in the house, except a pot of oil

contextId.information: This means that the men saw these items scattered along the road as they traveled. AT: "there were clothes and equipment all along the road" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: all the road was full of clothes and equipment

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration to show that a large group of people tore down the temple of Baal. AT: a large number of the people of the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: all the people of the land

contextId.information: This is a generalization. It is possible that some did not rejoice. AT: "many people in the land rejoiced" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: all the people of the land rejoiced

contextId.information: These are exaggerations to show that worship of false gods was widespread. AT: "on high hills and under green trees everywhere" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: on every high hill and under every green tree

contextId.information: He asks this question to emphasize that the army of Hezekiah does not have the resources to fight. AT: Possible meanings are 1) "You could not defeat even one of the least of the king's soldiers." or 2) "You could not defeat a group of the king's soldiers commanded by his least important officer." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: How could you resist even one captain of the least of my master's servants?

contextId.information: Hezekiah repeats the same idea in two ways to emphasize his point. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: They have seen everything in my house. There is nothing among my valuable things that I have not shown them

contextId.information: This is a generalization. AT: "some of the people in Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
This is a generalization. AT: "many other people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem

contextId.information: This is an exaggeration, and the word "Jerusalem" is a metonym for the people who lived there. AT: "Nebuchadnezzar took all the important people away from Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: He took into exile all Jerusalem

contextId.information: This is a generalization. AT: "many people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
